00328 #if RKH_TRACE == 1
00329 #if RKH_EN_TIMESTAMP == 1
00330     #if RKH_EN_TRACE_STRING == 1
00331         #define mktrevt( e, i, s, t, n, str )           \
00332                                                         \
00333                                 (e).id = i;             \
00334                                 (e).smix = s;           \
00335                                 (e).ts = t;             \
00336                                 (e).num = n;            \
00337                                 if( str != NULL )       \
00338                                 strcpy( (e).sb, str );  \
00339                                 rkh_trevt( &(e) )
00340     #else
00341         #define mktrevt( e, i, s, t, n, str )           \
00342                                                         \
00343                                 (e).id = i;             \
00344                                 (e).smix = s;           \
00345                                 (e).ts = t;             \
00346                                 (e).num = n;            \
00347                                 rkh_trevt( &(e) )
00348     #endif
00349 #else
00350     #if RKH_EN_TRACE_STRING == 1
00351         #define mktrevt( e, i, s, t, n, str )           \
00352                                                         \
00353                                 (e).id = i;             \
00354                                 (e).smix = s;           \
00355                                 (e).num = n;            \
00356                                 if( str != NULL )       \
00357                                 strcpy( (e).sb, str );  \
00358                                 rkh_trevt( &(e) )
00359     #else
00360         #define mktrevt( e, i, s, t, n, str )           \
00361                                                         \
00362                                 (e).id = i;             \
00363                                 (e).smix = s;           \
00364                                 (e).num = n;            \
00365                                 rkh_trevt( &(e) )
00366     #endif
00367 #endif
00368 #else
00369     #define mktrevt( e, i, s, t, n, str )
00370 #endif

00589 /*
00590  *  Portable data types.
00591  *
00592  *  The RKH uses a set of integer quantities. That maybe 
00593  *  machine or compiler dependent.
00594  *
00595  *  Note:
00596  *
00597  *  The 'HUInt' and 'HInt' will normally be the natural size 
00598  *  for a particular machine. These types designates an integer 
00599  *  type that is usually fastest to operate with among all integer 
00600  *  types.
00601  */
00602 
00603 typedef signed char     rkhint8;
00604 typedef signed short    rkhint16;
00605 typedef signed long     rkhint32;
00606 typedef unsigned char   rkhuint8;
00607 typedef unsigned short  rkhuint16;
00608 typedef unsigned long   rkhuint32;
00609 
00610 typedef unsigned int    HUInt;
00611 typedef signed int      HInt;
00612 
00613 
00614 /*
00615  *  Declaring an object rkhrom announces that its value will
00616  *  not be changed and it will be stored in ROM.
00617  */
00618 
00619 #define rkhrom          const   
00620 
00621 
00622 /*
00623  *  RKH needs to disable interrupts in order to access critical
00624  *  sections of code and to reenable interrupts when done.
00625  *  
00626  *  To hide the actual implementation method available for a
00627  *  particular processor, compiler, an OS, RKH defines the 
00628  *  following two macros to disable and enable interrupts 
00629  *  rkh_enter_critical() and define rkh_exit_critical() respectively.
00630  *  
00631  *  These macros are always together to wrap critical sections of
00632  *  code.
00633  */
00634 
00635 #define rkh_enter_critical()
00636 #define rkh_exit_critical()
00637 
00638 
00639 /*
00640  *  Defines trace facility support.
00641  *
00642  *  This definitions are required only when the user application
00643  *  is used trace facility (of course, RKH_TRACE == 1).
00644  */
00645 
00646 //#define rkh_tropen                        rkh_trace_open
00647 //#define rkh_trclose                       rkh_trace_close
00648 //#define rkh_trflush                       rkh_trace_flush
00649 //#define rkh_trgetts                       rkh_trace_getts
00650

00653  *  Defines dynamic event support.

00656  *  is used dynamic event (of course, RKH_EN_DYNAMIC_EVENT == 1).
00657  */

00660 #define rkh_dyne_init( mpd, pm, ps, bs )
00661 #define rkh_dyne_event_size( mpd )
00662 #define rkh_dyne_get( mpd, e )
00663 #define rkh_dyne_put( mpd, e )
00664 #define rkh_post_fifo( qd, e )
00665 #define rkh_post_lifo( qd, e )
00666 #define rkh_get( qd, e )
